intro: Panmorphia paranaensis, commonly known as the Paranaensis Panmorphia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant exhibits a distinct morphology with elongated, lance-shaped leaves and a woody stem covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
